definitions.definition: To ruin many or all things over a large area, such as most or all buildings of a city, or cities of a region, or trees of a forest.
To destroy a whole collection of related ideas, beliefs, and strongly held opinions.
To break beyond recovery or repair so that the only options are abandonment or the clearing away of useless remains (if any) and starting over.
Against; in opposition to.

definitions.definition: Compared with, as opposed to.

Bringing a legal action against, as used in the title of a court case in which the first party indicates the plaintiff (or appellant or the like), and the second indicates the defendant (or respondent or the like).
definitions.example: Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka, Kans.

definitions.definition: Pertaining to a symbol.
Implicitly representing or referring to another thing.

definitions.definition: The outward-projecting parts of the pelvis and top of the femur and the overlying tissue.
The inclined external angle formed by the intersection of two sloping roof planes.
In a bridge truss, the place where an inclined end post meets the top chord.
(possibly obsolete) A drug addict, especially someone addicted to a narcotic like heroin.
To use one's hips to bump into someone.
To throw (one's adversary) over one's hip ("cross-buttock").
To dislocate or sprain the hip of, to fracture or injure the hip bone of (a quadruped) in such a manner as to produce a permanent depression of that side.
To make with a hip or hips, as a roof.
The fruit of a rose.
To inform, to make knowledgeable.
Aware, informed, up-to-date, trendy.
A coursebook, a formal manual of instruction in a specific subject, especially one for use in schools or colleges.
Of or pertaining to textbooks or their style, especially in being dry and pedagogical; textbooky, textbooklike.
Having the typical characteristics of some class of phenomenon, so that it might be included as an example in a textbook.
The opposite.
One of a pair of propositions that cannot both be simultaneously true, , though they may both be false.
To oppose; to frustrate.
To impugn.
To contradict (someone or something).
To do the opposite of (someone or something).
To act inconsistently or perversely; to act in opposition to.
To argue; to debate; to uphold an opposite opinion.
To be self-contradictory; to become reversed.
Opposite; in an opposite direction; in opposition; adverse.

definitions.definition: Opposed; contradictory; inconsistent.

definitions.definition: Given to opposition; perverse; wayward.

definitions.definition: Contrarily
To put an end to, especially with force, to crush, do away with; to prohibit, subdue.

definitions.definition: To restrain or repress, such as laughter or an expression.

definitions.definition: To exclude undesirable thoughts from one's mind.

definitions.definition: To prevent publication.

definitions.definition: To stop a flow or stream.

definitions.definition: To forbid the use of evidence at trial because it is improper or was improperly obtained.
To reduce unwanted frequencies in a signal.
To hold in place, to keep low.
Anything movable (a good) that is bought and sold.
Something useful or valuable.
Raw materials, agricultural and other primary products as objects of large-scale trading in specialized exchanges.

definitions.definition: Undifferentiated goods characterized by a low profit margin, as distinguished from branded products.

definitions.definition: Anything which has both a use-value and an exchange-value.
Convenience; usefulness, suitability.
Self-interest; personal convenience or advantage.
Of or relating to administering or administration.
A spoken test or examination, particularly in a language class.

Oral sex.

definitions.definition: Spoken rather than written.

definitions.definition: A personal weapon that uses explosive powder to propel a projectile often made of lead.
To leave or withdraw from; to quit; to retire from

definitions.definition: To make empty; to empty out; to remove the contents of, including to create a vacuum.

definitions.definition: To make empty; to deprive.
To remove; to eject; to void; to discharge, as the contents of a vessel, or of the bowels.
To make void; to nullify; to vacate.

definitions.definition: Information (or an artefact) that is granted or obtained exclusively.
definitions.example: The editor agreed to keep a lid on a potentially disastrous political scoop in exchange for an exclusive of a happier nature.

definitions.definition: A member of a group who exclude others from their society.
(grammar) A word or phrase that restricts something, such as only, solely, or simply.
Excluding items or members that do not meet certain conditions.

Referring to a membership organisation, service or product: of high quality and/or renown, for superior members only. A snobbish usage, suggesting that members who do not meet requirements, which may be financial, of celebrity, religion, skin colour etc., are excluded.
definitions.example: Exclusive clubs tend to serve exclusive brands of food and drinks, in the same exorbitant price range, such as the 'finest' French châteaux.

definitions.definition: Exclusionary.
Whole, undivided, entire.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to the first-person plural pronoun when excluding the person being addressed.

definitions.definition: (of two people in a romantic or sexual relationship) Having a romantic or sexual relationship with one another, to the exclusion of others.

definitions.definition: Any mathematical rule expressed symbolically.
A symbolic expression of the structure of a compound.

definitions.definition: A plan or method for dealing with a problem or for achieving a result.

definitions.definition: A formulation; a prescription; a mixture or solution made in a prescribed manner; the identity and quantities of ingredients of such a mixture.

definitions.definition: A formal statement of doctrine, as in religion.

A syntactic expression of a proposition, built up from quantifiers, logical connectives, variables, relation and operation symbols, and, depending on the type of logic, possibly other operators such as modal, temporal, deontic or epistemic ones.
A manufactured food simulating human breast milk, designed to be fed to babies and infants under 12 months of age.
The soft skin on each side of the face, below the eyes; the outer surface of the sides of the oral cavity.
(usually in the plural) The lower part of the buttocks that is often exposed beneath very brief underwear, swimwear, or extremely short shorts.

Synonym of mair, various former officials in the Kingdom of Scotland.

Exactly 4.54609 liters; an imperial gallon
231 cubic inches or approximately 3.785 liters for liquids (a "U.S. liquid gallon")
One-eighth of a U.S. bushel or approximately 4.405 liters for dry goods (a "U.S. dry gallon").

definitions.definition: Able to be predicted.

definitions.definition: A strong will, determination.
The state of being resolute.

definitions.definition: A statement of intent, a vow

definitions.definition: The act of discerning detail.

The autism spectrum.

A student; one who studies at school or college, typically having a scholarship.

Believable or plausible.
Authentic or convincing.

A machine that performs a job typically accomplished using an animal or manual labor.

definitions.example: Boring, drilling, milling, and turning are all different kinds of metal cutting processes.

definitions.definition: The act of cutting one's own skin as a symptom of a mental disorder; self-harm.
That is used for cutting.
definitions.example: I need some sort of cutting utensil to get through this shrink wrap.

definitions.definition: Piercing, sharp.
Of criticism, remarks, etc.: (potentially) hurtful.
definitions.example: The director gave the auditioning actors cutting criticism.

definitions.definition: Of a beverage: half-sized.
definitions.example: a cutting chai

definitions.definition: A large, naturally-occurring cavity formed underground or in the face of a cliff or a hillside.
definitions.example: We found a cave on the mountainside where we could take shelter.

definitions.definition: A hole, depression, or gap in earth or rock, whether natural or man-made.
A storage cellar, especially for wine or cheese.
definitions.example: This wine has been aged in our cave for thirty years.

definitions.definition: A place of retreat, such as a man cave.
definitions.example: My room was a cozy cave where I could escape from my family.

definitions.definition: A naturally-occurring cavity in bedrock which is large enough to be entered by an adult.
definitions.example: It was not strictly a cave, but a narrow fissure in the rock.

definitions.definition: A shielded area where nuclear experiments can be carried out.
(drilling) Debris, particularly broken rock, which falls into a drill hole and interferes with drilling.
A collapse or cave-in.
The vagina.
(often "Cave") A group that breaks from a larger political party or faction on a particular issue.
Any hollow place, or part; a cavity.
A code cave.
To surrender.
definitions.example: He caved under pressure.

definitions.definition: To collapse.
definitions.example: First the braces buckled, then the roof began to cave, then we ran.

definitions.definition: To hollow out or undermine.
definitions.example: The levee has been severely caved by the river current.

definitions.definition: To engage in the recreational exploration of caves.
definitions.example: I have caved from Yugoslavia to Kentucky.

definitions.definition: In room-and-pillar mining, to extract a deposit of rock by breaking down a pillar which had been holding it in place.
definitions.example: The deposit is caved by knocking out the posts.

definitions.definition: To work over tailings to dress small pieces of marketable ore.
To dwell in a cave.
(public school slang) look out!; beware!
The money originally invested or loaned, on which basis interest and returns are calculated.
definitions.example: A portion of your mortgage payment goes to reduce the principal, and the rest covers interest.

definitions.definition: The chief administrator of a school.
The chief executive and chief academic officer of a university or college.
A legal person that authorizes another (the agent) to act on their behalf; or on whose behalf an agent or gestor in a negotiorum gestio acts.
definitions.example: My principal sells metal shims.

definitions.definition: The primary participant in a crime.
A partner or owner of a business.
A diapason, a type of organ stop on a pipe organ.
The construction that gives shape and strength to a roof, generally a truss of timber or iron; or, loosely, the most important member of a piece of framing.
The first two long feathers of a hawk's wing.
One of the turrets or pinnacles of waxwork and tapers with which the posts and centre of a funeral hearse were formerly crowned.
An essential point or rule; a principle.
A dancer at the highest rank within a professional dance company, particularly a ballet company.
A security principal.
Primary; most important; first level in importance.
definitions.example: Smith is the principal architect of this design.

definitions.definition: (Latinism) Of or relating to a prince; princely.
To pull (something) back, aside, or away.
To stop talking to, or interacting with, other people and start thinking thoughts that are not related to what is happening around.
To take back (a comment, etc); retract.
definitions.example: to withdraw false charges

definitions.definition: To remove, to stop providing (one's support, etc); to take out of service.
To extract (money from an account).
To retreat.
To be in withdrawal from an addictive drug etc.
A fall, trip or substantial misstep.
An error or blunder.
A clumsy walk.
To trip or fall; to walk clumsily.
definitions.example: He stumbled over a rock.

definitions.definition: To make a mistake or have trouble.
definitions.example: I always stumble over verbs in Spanish.

definitions.definition: To cause to stumble or trip.
To mislead; to confound; to cause to err or to fall.
To strike or happen (upon a person or thing) without design; to fall or light by chance; with on, upon, or against.
A place where nursing or the raising of children is carried on.
A place where anything is fostered and growth promoted.
Something which educates and nurtures.
definitions.example: Commerce is the nursery of seamen.

definitions.definition: Short for nursery cannon.
Someone or something that is nursed; a nursling.
The act of nursing or rearing.
An immersion in water etc.
definitions.example: After the strenuous climb, I had a nice long soak in a bath.

definitions.definition: A drunkard.
A carouse; a drinking session.
A low-lying depression that fills with water after rain.
To be saturated with liquid by being immersed in it.
definitions.example: I'm going to soak in the bath for a couple of hours.

definitions.definition: To immerse in liquid to the point of saturation or thorough permeation.
definitions.example: Soak the beans overnight before cooking.

definitions.definition: To penetrate or permeate by saturation.
definitions.example: The water soaked into my shoes and gave me wet feet.

definitions.definition: To allow (especially a liquid) to be absorbed; to take in, receive. (usually + up)
definitions.example: A sponge soaks up water; the skin soaks in moisture.

definitions.definition: To take money from.
To drink intemperately or gluttonously.
To heat (a metal) before shaping it.
To hold a kiln at a particular temperature for a given period of time.
definitions.example: We should soak the kiln at cone 9 for half an hour.

definitions.definition: To absorb; to drain.
To issue (something, such as printed work) for distribution and/or sale.
definitions.example: Most of the sketches Faulkner published in 1925 appeared in the Sunday magazine section of the New Orleans Times-Picayune.

definitions.definition: To announce to the public.
definitions.example: No newspaper published the victim's name.

definitions.definition: To issue the work of (an author).
definitions.example: Grove Press published many avant-garde authors.

definitions.definition: To disseminate (a message) publicly via a newsgroup, forum, blog, etc.
To issue a medium (e.g. publication).
definitions.example: Major city papers still publish daily.

definitions.definition: To have one's work accepted for a publication.
definitions.example: She needs to publish in order to get tenure.

definitions.definition: (of content) To be made available in a printed publication or other medium.
definitions.example: The article first published online, then in print the next day.

definitions.definition: To convert data of a Web page to HTML in a local directory and copy it to the Web site on a remote system.
The industry of publishing, including the production and distribution of books, magazines, web sites, newspapers, etc.
Something published; a publication.
Pertaining to architecture.
Resembling architecture in style; seeming to have been designed (by an architect).
The manner, pose, or posture in which one stands.
definitions.example: The fencer’s stance showed he was ready to begin.

definitions.definition: One's opinion or point of view.
definitions.example: I don’t agree with your stance on gun control.

definitions.definition: A place to stand; a position, a site, a station.
A place for buses or taxis to await passengers; a bus stop, a taxi rank.
A place where a fair or market is held; a location where a street trader can carry on business.
A stanza.
To place, to position, to station; (specifically) to put (cattle) into an enclosure or pen in preparation for sale.
A group of vessels or vehicles.
Any group of associated items.
A large, coordinated group of people.
A number of vessels in company, especially war vessels; also, the collective naval force of a country, etc.
(British Royal Navy) Any command of vessels exceeding a squadron in size, or a rear admiral's command, composed of five sail-of-the-line, with any number of smaller vessels.
An arm of the sea; a run of water, such as an inlet or a creek.
A location, as on a navigable river, where barges are secured.
To float.
To pass over rapidly; to skim the surface of.
definitions.example: a ship that fleets the gulf

definitions.definition: To hasten over; to cause to pass away lightly, or in mirth and joy.
To flee, to escape, to speed away.
To evanesce, disappear, die out.
To move up a rope, so as to haul to more advantage; especially to draw apart the blocks of a tackle.
(of people) To move or change in position.
To shift the position of dead-eyes when the shrouds are become too long.
To cause to slip down the barrel of a capstan or windlass, as a rope or chain.
To take the cream from; to skim.
Swift in motion; light and quick in going from place to place.
Light; superficially thin; not penetrating deep, as soil.
Floor; bottom; lower surface.
A house; home.
A thing that has been reconstructed or restored to an earlier state.
The act of restoring something to an earlier state.
definitions.example: The reconstruction of the medieval bridge began last year.

definitions.definition: A result of an attempt to understand in detail how a certain result or event occurred.
definitions.example: The detective's reconstruction of what happened that night is dubious.

definitions.definition: Something that is variable.
Something whose value may be dictated or discovered.
definitions.example: There are several variables to consider here.

definitions.definition: A quantity that may assume any one of a set of values.
A symbol representing a variable.
A named memory location in which a program can store intermediate results and from which it can read them.
A variable star.
A shifting wind, or one that varies in force.
(in the plural) Those parts of the sea where a steady wind is not expected, especially the parts between the trade-wind belts.
Able to vary or be varied.
definitions.example: variable winds or seasons; a variable quantity; a variable resistor

definitions.definition: Likely to vary.
Marked by diversity or difference.
Having no fixed quantitative value.
Tending to deviate from a normal or recognized type.
A thin and usually jagged space opened in a previously solid material.
definitions.example: A large crack had formed in the roadway.

definitions.definition: A narrow opening.
definitions.example: Open the door a crack.

definitions.definition: A sharply humorous comment; a wisecrack.
definitions.example: I didn't appreciate that crack about my hairstyle.

definitions.definition: Crack cocaine, a potent, relatively cheap, addictive variety of cocaine; often a rock, usually smoked through a crack-pipe.
definitions.example: crack head

definitions.definition: The sharp sound made when solid material breaks.
definitions.example: The crack of the falling branch could be heard for miles.

definitions.definition: Any sharp sound.
definitions.example: The crack of the bat hitting the ball.

definitions.definition: A sharp, resounding blow.
An attempt at something.
definitions.example: I'd like to take a crack at that game.

definitions.definition: Vagina.
definitions.example: I'm so horny even the crack of dawn isn't safe!

definitions.definition: The space between the buttocks.
definitions.example: Pull up your pants! Your crack is showing.

definitions.definition: Conviviality; fun; good conversation, chat, gossip, or humorous storytelling; good company.
definitions.example: He/she is quare good crack.

definitions.definition: Business; events; news.
definitions.example: What's the crack?

definitions.definition: A program or procedure designed to circumvent restrictions or usage limits on software.
definitions.example: Has anyone got a crack for DocumentWriter 3.0?

definitions.definition: (elsewhere throughout the North of the UK) a meaningful chat.
Extremely silly, absurd or off-the-wall ideas or prose.
The tone of voice when changed at puberty.
A mental flaw; a touch of craziness; partial insanity.
definitions.example: He has a crack.

definitions.definition: A crazy or crack-brained person.
A boast; boasting.
Breach of chastity.
A boy, generally a pert, lively boy.
A brief time; an instant; a jiffy.
definitions.example: I'll be with you in a crack.

definitions.definition: To form cracks.
definitions.example: It's been so dry, the ground is starting to crack.

definitions.definition: To break apart under pressure.
definitions.example: When I tried to stand on the chair, it cracked.

definitions.definition: To become debilitated by psychological pressure.
definitions.example: Anyone would crack after being hounded like that.

definitions.definition: To break down or yield, especially under interrogation or torture.
definitions.example: When we showed him the pictures of the murder scene, he cracked.

definitions.definition: To make a cracking sound.
definitions.example: The bat cracked with authority and the ball went for six.

definitions.definition: (of a voice) To change rapidly in register.
definitions.example: His voice cracked with emotion.

definitions.definition: (of a pubescent boy's voice) To alternate between high and low register in the process of eventually lowering.
definitions.example: His voice finally cracked when he was fourteen.

definitions.definition: To make a sharply humorous comment.
definitions.example: "I would too, with a face like that," she cracked.

definitions.definition: To make a crack or cracks in.
definitions.example: The ball cracked the window.

definitions.definition: To break open or crush to small pieces by impact or stress.
definitions.example: You'll need a hammer to crack a black walnut.

definitions.definition: To strike forcefully.
definitions.example: She cracked him over the head with her handbag.

definitions.definition: To open slightly.
definitions.example: Could you please crack the window?

definitions.definition: To cause to yield under interrogation or other pressure. (Figurative)
definitions.example: They managed to crack him on the third day.

definitions.definition: To solve a difficult problem. (Figurative, from cracking a nut.)
definitions.example: I've finally cracked it, and of course the answer is obvious in hindsight.

definitions.definition: To overcome a security system or a component.
definitions.example: It took a minute to crack the lock, three minutes to crack the security system, and about twenty minutes to crack the safe.

definitions.definition: To cause to make a sharp sound.
definitions.example: to crack a whip

definitions.definition: To tell (a joke).
definitions.example: The performance was fine until he cracked that dead baby joke.

definitions.definition: To break down (a complex molecule), especially with the application of heat: to pyrolyse.
definitions.example: Acetone is cracked to ketene and methane at 700°C.

definitions.definition: To circumvent software restrictions such as regional coding or time limits.
definitions.example: That software licence will expire tomorrow unless we can crack it.

definitions.definition: To open a canned beverage, or any packaged drink or food.
definitions.example: I'd love to crack open a beer.

definitions.definition: To brag, boast.
To be ruined or impaired; to fail.
Highly trained and competent.
definitions.example: Even a crack team of investigators would have trouble solving this case.

definitions.definition: Excellent, first-rate, superior, top-notch.
definitions.example: She's a crack shot with that rifle.

definitions.definition: Characterised by or exhibiting elegance.
Characterised by minimalism and intuitiveness while preserving exactness and precision.
definitions.example: an elegant solution

definitions.definition: Fine; doing well.
Any of various medical instruments used to explore wounds, organs, etc.
Something which penetrates something else, as though to explore; something which obtains information.
An act of probing; a prod, a poke.
An investigation or inquiry.
definitions.example: They launched a probe into the cause of the accident.

definitions.definition: A tube attached to an aircraft which can be fitted into the drogue from a tanker aircraft to allow for aerial refuelling.
A small device, especially an electrode, used to explore, investigate or measure something by penetrating or being placed in it.
definitions.example: Insert the probe into the soil and read the temperature.

definitions.definition: A small, usually unmanned, spacecraft used to acquire information or measurements about its surroundings.
(game of go) a move with multiple answers seeking to make the opponent choose and commit to a strategy
Any group of atoms or molecules radioactively labeled in order to study a given molecule or other structure
To explore, investigate, or question
definitions.example: If you probe further, you may discover different reasons.

definitions.definition: To insert a probe into.
A group of people, especially within a political organization, which expresses a shared belief or opinion different from people who are not part of the group.
Strife; discord.
A form of literature, film etc., that treats real people or events as if they were fiction; a mix of fact and fiction
Done or occurring often; common.
definitions.example: I am a frequent visitor to that city.

definitions.definition: Occurring at short intervals.
Addicted to any course of conduct; inclined to indulge in any practice; habitual; persistent.
Full; crowded; thronged.
Often or commonly reported.
To visit often.
definitions.example: I used to frequent that restaurant.

definitions.definition: A homosexual woman, one who is mostly or exclusively sexually or romantically attracted to other women.
A homosexual female animal.
(of a woman) Homosexual, gay; preferring mostly or exclusively women as romantic or sexual partners.
definitions.example: She is lesbian.

definitions.definition: (of a romantic or sexual act or relationship) Between two or more women; homosexual, gay.
definitions.example: a lesbian relationship / marriage / kiss

definitions.definition: (especially of an institution or group) Intended for lesbians.
definitions.example: We're going to a lesbian bar tonight.

definitions.definition: A single piece of a given material, elongated and roughly round in cross-section, often twisted with other fibres to form thread.
definitions.example: The microscope showed several different fibres stuck to the sole of the shoe.

definitions.definition: Material in the form of fibres.
definitions.example: The cloth was made from strange, somewhat rough fibre.

definitions.definition: Dietary fibre.
definitions.example: Fresh vegetables are a good source of fibre.

definitions.definition: Moral strength and resolve.
definitions.example: The ordeal was a test of everyone’s fibre.

definitions.definition: The preimage of a given point in the range of a map.
definitions.example: Under this map, any two values in the fibre of a given point on the circle differ by 2π

definitions.definition: Said to be of a morphism over a global element: The pullback of the said morphism along the said global element.
A kind of lightweight thread of execution.
A long tubular cell found in muscle tissue; myocyte.
An assessment, such as an annual personnel performance review used as the basis for a salary increase or bonus, or a summary of a particular situation.
A completion of a mathematical operation; a valuation.
Determination of the value of a variable or expression.
The act of conceding.
An act of conceding, particularly:
A gift freely given or act freely made as a token of respect or to curry favor.
A franchise: a business operated as a concession (see above).
(usually in the plural) An item sold within a concession (see above) or from a concessions stand.
A person eligible for a concession price (see above).
To grant or approve by means of a concession agreement.
The absolute or relative size, extent or importance of something.
An order of magnitude.
A number, assigned to something, such that it may be compared to others numerically
Of a vector, the norm, most commonly, the two-norm.
A logarithmic scale of brightness defined so that a difference of 5 magnitudes is a factor of 100.
A measure of the energy released by an earthquake (e.g. on the Richter scale).
One appointed as the substitute of another, and empowered to act for them, in their name or their behalf; a substitute in office

definitions.definition: A person employed to install and remove props, brattices, etc. and to clear gas, for the safety of the miners.
(France): A member of the Chamber of Deputies, formerly called Corps Législatif
(Ireland): a member of Dáil Éireann, or the title of a member of Dáil Éireann. (Normally capitalised in both cases)
definitions.example: At today's meeting, Deputy Ryan will speak on local issues.

definitions.definition: (United States): a law enforcement officer who works for the county sheriff's office; a deputy sheriff or sheriff's deputy; the entry level rank in such an agency
definitions.example: The sheriff's deputies took the suspect into custody.

definitions.definition: To deputise
A throw, a lob, of a ball etc., with an initial upward direction, particularly with a lack of care.
The coin toss before a cricket match in order to decide who bats first, or before a football match in order to decide the direction of play.
A haughty throwing up of the head.
(British slang) A jot, in the phrase 'give a toss'.

definitions.definition: (British slang) A state of agitation; commotion.
A measure of sprats.
To throw with an initial upward direction.

definitions.definition: To lift with a sudden or violent motion.

definitions.definition: To agitate; to make restless.
To subject to trials; to harass.
To flip a coin, to decide a point of contention.

definitions.definition: To discard: to toss out
definitions.example: I don't need it any more; you can just toss it.

definitions.definition: To stir or mix (a salad).

definitions.definition: (British slang) To masturbate
To search (a room or a cell), sometimes leaving visible disorder, as for valuables or evidence of a crime.
definitions.example: "Someone tossed just his living room and bedroom." / "They probably found what they were looking for."

definitions.definition: To roll and tumble; to be in violent commotion.
definitions.example: tossing and turning in bed, unable to sleep

definitions.definition: To be tossed, as a fleet on the ocean, or as a ship in heavy seas.
To keep in play; to tumble over.

definitions.definition: To peak (the oars), to lift them from the rowlocks and hold them perpendicularly, the handle resting on the bottom of the boat.
(British slang) To drink in large draughts; to gulp.
To eject something violently (such as lava or water, as from a volcano or geyser).

definitions.definition: To burst forth; to break out.
definitions.example: The third molar tooth erupts late in most people, and sometimes does not appear at all.

definitions.definition: To spontaneously release pressure or tension.
definitions.example: The crowd erupted in anger.

definitions.definition: A writer of history; a chronicler; an annalist.
One who studies or researches history.
One who recounts their own medical history.
A set of pieces that work together in unison as a mechanism or device.

definitions.definition: The act of putting together a set of pieces, fragments, or elements.
definitions.example: assembly line

definitions.definition: A congregation of people in one place for a purpose.
definitions.example: freedom of assembly

definitions.definition: A legislative body.
A beat of the drum or sound of the bugle as a signal to troops to assemble.

In Microsoft .NET, a building block of an application, similar to a DLL, but containing both executable code and information normally found in a DLL's type library. The type library information in an assembly, called a manifest, describes public functions, data, classes, and version information.
A programming language in which the source code of programs is composed of mnemonic instructions, each of which corresponds directly to a machine instruction for a particular processor.
definitions.example: A skilled programmer can write very fast code in assembly language.

definitions.definition: A reciprocal, parallel or complementary relationship between two or more comparable objects.
One of the several measures of the linear statistical relationship between two random variables, indicating both the strength and direction of the relationship.
An isomorphism from a projective space to the dual of a projective space, often to the dual of itself.
The act of interfering with something, or something that interferes.
The illegal obstruction of an opponent in some ball games.
definitions.example: They were glued to the TV, as the referee called out a fifteen yard penalty for interference.

definitions.definition: An effect caused by the superposition of two systems of waves.
A distortion on a broadcast signal due to atmospheric or other effects.
definitions.example: They wanted to watch the game on TV, but there was too much interference to even make out the score on the tiny screen.

definitions.definition: In United States patent law, an inter partes proceeding to determine the priority issues of multiple patent applications; a priority contest.
The interruption of the line between an attacked piece and its defender by sacrificially interposing a piece.
The situation where a person who knows two languages inappropriately transfers lexical items or structures from one to the other.
To limp; move with a limping gait.
To stand in doubt whether to proceed, or what to do; hesitate; be uncertain; linger; delay; mammer.
To be lame, faulty, or defective, as in connection with ideas, or in measure, or in versification.
To waver.
To falter.
A cessation, either temporary or permanent.
definitions.example: The contract negotiations put a halt to operations.

definitions.definition: A minor railway station (usually unstaffed) in the United Kingdom.
definitions.example: The halt itself never achieved much importance, even with workers coming to and from the adjacent works.

definitions.definition: To stop marching.
To stop either temporarily or permanently.
To bring to a stop.
To cause to discontinue.
definitions.example: The contract negotiations halted operations for at least a week.

definitions.definition: Lameness; a limp.
Lame, limping.
To render dull; to remove or blunt an edge or something that was sharp.
definitions.example: Years of misuse have dulled the tools.

definitions.definition: To soften, moderate or blunt; to make dull, stupid, or sluggish; to stupefy.
definitions.example: He drinks to dull the pain.

definitions.definition: To lose a sharp edge; to become dull.
definitions.example: A razor will dull with use.

definitions.definition: To render dim or obscure; to sully; to tarnish.
Lacking the ability to cut easily; not sharp.
definitions.example: All these knives are dull.

definitions.definition: Boring; not exciting or interesting.
definitions.example: He sat through the dull lecture and barely stayed awake.

definitions.definition: Not shiny; having a matte finish or no particular luster or brightness.
definitions.example: Choose a dull finish to hide fingerprints.

definitions.definition: Not bright or intelligent; stupid; having slow understanding.
Sluggish, listless.
Cloudy, overcast.
definitions.example: It's a dull day.

definitions.definition: Insensible; unfeeling.
Heavy; lifeless; inert.
(of pain etc) Not intense; felt indistinctly or only slightly.
definitions.example: Pressing on the bruise produces a dull pain.

definitions.definition: (of a noise or sound) Not clear, muffled.
Something which is emitted or sent out; issue.
definitions.example: the emission was mostly blood

definitions.definition: The act of emitting; the act of sending forth or putting into circulation.
definitions.example: the emission of heat from a fire

definitions.definition: A violent collision or compression; a crash; destruction; ruin.
Violent pressure, as of a moving crowd.
A crowd that produces uncomfortable pressure.
definitions.example: a crush at a reception

definitions.definition: A violent crowding.
A crowd control barrier.
A drink made by squeezing the juice out of fruit.
An infatuation with somebody one is not dating.
definitions.example: I've had a huge crush on her since we met many years ago.

definitions.definition: A standing stock or cage with movable sides used to restrain livestock for safe handling.
A party or festive function.
The process of crushing cane to remove the raw sugar, or the season when this process takes place.
To press between two hard objects; to squeeze so as to alter the natural shape or integrity of it, or to force together into a mass.
definitions.example: to crush grapes

definitions.definition: To reduce to fine particles by pounding or grinding
definitions.example: to crush quartz

definitions.definition: To overwhelm by pressure or weight.
definitions.example: After the corruption scandal, the opposition crushed the ruling party in the elections

definitions.definition: To oppress or grievously burden.
To overcome completely; to subdue totally.
definitions.example: The sultan's black guard crushed every resistance bloodily.

definitions.definition: To be or become broken down or in, or pressed into a smaller compass, by external weight or force
definitions.example: an eggshell crushes easily

definitions.definition: To feel infatuation or unrequited love.
definitions.example: She's crushing on him.

definitions.definition: To give a compressed or foreshortened appearance to.
The track or indication marking the route followed by something that has passed, such as the footprints of animal on land or the contrail of an airplane in the sky.
A route for travel over land, especially a narrow, unpaved pathway for use by hikers, horseback riders, etc.
A trailer broadcast on television for a forthcoming film or programme.
A walk in which all the edges are distinct.
To follow behind (someone or something); to tail (someone or something).
definitions.example: The hunters trailed their prey deep into the woods.

definitions.definition: To drag (something) behind on the ground.
definitions.example: You'll get your coat all muddy if you trail it around like that.

definitions.definition: To leave (a trail of).
definitions.example: He walked into the house, soaking wet, and trailed water all over the place.

definitions.definition: To show a trailer of (a film, TV show etc.); to release or publish a preview of (a report etc.) in advance of the full publication.
definitions.example: His new film was trailed on TV last night.

definitions.definition: To hang or drag loosely behind; to move with a slow sweeping motion.
definitions.example: The bride's long dress trailed behind her as she walked down the aisle.

definitions.definition: To run or climb like certain plants.
To drag oneself lazily or reluctantly along.
definitions.example: Our parents marched to church and we trailed behind.

definitions.definition: To be losing, to be behind in a competition.
To carry (a firearm) with the breech near the ground and the upper part inclined forward, the piece being held by the right hand near the middle.
To flatten (grass, etc.) by walking through it; to tread down.
To take advantage of the ignorance of; to impose upon.
To make things, usually on a large scale, with tools and either physical labor or machinery.
To work (raw or partly wrought materials) into suitable forms for use.
definitions.example: to manufacture wool into blankets

definitions.definition: To fabricate; to create false evidence to support a point.
The transformation of raw materials into finished products, usually on a large scale.
The industry in which such products are made.
Used in manufacturing.
The act of founding, fixing, establishing, or beginning to erect.
definitions.example: The foundation of his institute has been wrought with difficulty.

definitions.definition: That upon which anything is founded; that on which anything stands, and by which it is supported; the lowest and supporting layer of a superstructure; underbuilding.
The result of the work to begin something; that which stabilizes and allows an enterprise or system to develop.
In solitaire or patience games, one of the piles of cards that the player attempts to build, usually holding all cards of a suit in ascending order.
The lowest and supporting part or member of a wall, including the base course and footing courses; in a frame house, the whole substructure of masonry.
definitions.example: The foundations of this construction have been laid out.

definitions.definition: A donation or legacy appropriated to support a charitable institution, and constituting a permanent fund; endowment.
That which is founded, or established by endowment; an endowed institution or charity.
definitions.example: The Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. is the parent organization of the Wiktionary collaborative project.

definitions.definition: Cosmetic cream roughly skin-colored, designed to make the face appear uniform in color and texture.
A basis for social bodies or intellectual disciplines.
Pulsing with energy or activity.
definitions.example: He has a vibrant personality.

definitions.definition: Lively and vigorous.
Vibrating, resonant or resounding.
(of a colour) Bright.
The act of excluding or shutting out; removal from consideration or taking part.
The act of pushing or forcing something out.
An item not covered by an insurance policy.
One skilled in divinity; a theologian.
A minister of the gospel; a priest; a clergyman.
(often capitalized, with 'the') God or a god, particularly in its aspect as a transcendental concept.
Of or pertaining to a god.
Eternal, holy, or otherwise godlike.
Of superhuman or surpassing excellence.
Beautiful, heavenly.
Foreboding; prescient.
(of souls) immortal; elect or saved after death
Relating to divinity or theology.
To foretell (something), especially by the use of divination.
To guess or discover (something) through intuition or insight.
To search for (underground objects or water) using a divining rod.
To render divine; to deify.
The act or instance of supervising.
definitions.example: Under his parents' supervision he drilled the holes in the wood.

definitions.definition: Responsible oversight.
definitions.example: Do not attempt this without adequate supervision.

definitions.definition: (Cambridge University) A tutorial session for an individual student or a small group.
A document containing a certified statement.
A document evidencing ownership or debt.
A document serving as evidence as a person has completed an educational course, issued either by an institution not authorised to grant diplomas, or to a student not qualifying for a diploma.
The information needed in order to verify a positive answer to a problem.
A motion picture age rating.
definitions.example: The film is certificate 15.

definitions.definition: To supply with a certificate, especially following certification
An artificial waterway or artificially improved river used for travel, shipping, or irrigation.
A tubular channel within the body.
One of the faint, hazy markings resembling straight lines on early telescopic images of the surface of Mars.
To dig an artificial waterway in or to (a place), especially for drainage
To travel along a canal by boat
A conclusive success following an effort, conflict, or confrontation of obstacles; victory; conquest.
definitions.example: the triumph of knowledge

definitions.definition: A magnificent and imposing ceremonial performed in honor of a victor.
Any triumphal procession; a pompous exhibition; a stately show or pageant.
A state of joy or exultation at success.
A trump card.
A card game, also called trump.
A ceremony held to publicly celebrate and sanctify the military achievement of an army commander.
A work of art, cuisine, etc. of very high quality.
definitions.example: Scorsese's latest film is a triumph.

definitions.definition: To celebrate victory with pomp; to rejoice over success; to exult in an advantage gained; to exhibit exultation.
To prevail over rivals, challenges, or difficulties.
To succeed, win, or attain ascendancy.
To be prosperous; to flourish.
To play a trump in a card game.

An army of trained civilians, which may be an official reserve army, called upon in time of need, the entire able-bodied population of a state which may also be called upon, or a private force not under government control.
The police in the Soviet Union and some related or successor states (e.g. modern Belarus).
Of, relating to, operating by, or caused by magnetism.
definitions.example: a magnetic recorder

definitions.definition: Having the properties of a magnet, especially the ability to draw or pull.
Determined by earth's magnetic fields.
definitions.example: magnetic north

definitions.definition: Having an extraordinary ability to attract.
definitions.example: He has a magnetic personality.

definitions.definition: Having, susceptible to, or induced by, animal magnetism.
definitions.example: a magnetic sleep

definitions.definition: A jump or plunge into water.
definitions.example: the dive of a hawk after prey

definitions.definition: A headfirst jump toward the ground or into another substance.
A downward swooping motion.
A swim under water.
A decline.
A seedy bar, nightclub, etc.
Aerial descent with the nose pointed down.
A deliberate fall after a challenge.
To swim under water.
To jump into water head-first.
To jump headfirst toward the ground or into another substance.
definitions.example: to dive into home plate

definitions.definition: To descend sharply or steeply.
(especially with in) To undertake with enthusiasm.
definitions.example: She dove right in and started making improvements.

definitions.definition: To deliberately fall down after a challenge, imitating being fouled, in the hope of getting one's opponent penalised.
To cause to descend, dunk; to plunge something into water.
To explore by diving; to plunge into.
To plunge or to go deeply into any subject, question, business, etc.; to penetrate; to explore.
Any female celebrity, usually a well known singer or actress.

A person who may be considered or who considers herself (or by extension himself) much more important than others, has high expectations of others and who is extremely demanding and fussy when it comes to personal privileges.
A supernatural entity of disagreeable nature.
(manner) In a consistent manner.
(frequency) constantly; always.
The act of reproducing new individuals biologically.
The act of making copies.
definitions.example: Unauthorized reproduction of this article is prohibited.

definitions.definition: A copy of something, as in a piece of art; a duplicate.
definitions.example: Jim was proud of the Rembrandt reproduction he owned.

definitions.definition: To render a representation of something, using words, sounds, images, or other means.
Depicted.
A royal, imperial or princely headdress; a diadem.
A wreath or band for the head, especially one given as reward of victory or a mark of honor.
(by extension) Any reward of victory or mark of honor.
definitions.example: the martyr's crown

definitions.definition: Imperial or regal power, or those who wield it.
(metonym) The sovereign (in a monarchy), as head of state.
(by extension) The state, the government (headed by a monarch).
definitions.example: Treasure recovered from shipwrecks automatically becomes property of the Crown.

definitions.definition: The top part of something:
A kind of spire or lantern formed by converging flying buttresses.
Splendor; culmination; acme.

Any currency (originally) issued by the crown (regal power) and often bearing a crown (headdress); (translation) various currencies known by similar names in their native languages, such as the koruna, kruna, krone, korona.
A former pre-decimalization British coin worth five shillings.
The part of a plant where the root and stem meet.
The top of a tree.
The part of a tooth above the gums.
A prosthetic covering for a tooth.
A knot formed in the end of a rope by tucking in the strands to prevent them from unravelling
The part of an anchor where the arms and the shank meet
The rounding, or rounded part, of the deck from a level line.
(in the plural) The bights formed by the turns of a cable.
In England, a standard size of printing paper measuring 20 × 15 inches.
In American, a standard size of writing paper measuring 19 × 15 inches.
A monocyclic ligand having three or more binding sites, capable of holding a guest in a central location
During childbirth, the appearance of the baby's head from the mother's vagina
A rounding or smoothing of the barrel opening
The area enclosed between two concentric perimeters.
A round spot shaved clean on the top of the head, as a mark of the clerical state; the tonsure.
A whole bird with the legs and wings removed to produce a joint of white meat.
A formal hat worn by women to Sunday church services; a church crown.
The knurled knob or dial, on the outside of a watch case, used to wind it or adjust the hands.
To place a crown on the head of.
To formally declare (someone) a king, queen, emperor, etc.
To bestow something upon as a mark of honour, dignity, or recompense; to adorn; to dignify.
To form the topmost or finishing part of; to complete; to consummate; to perfect.
To declare (someone) a winner.
Of a baby, during the birthing process; for the surface of the baby's head to appear in the vaginal opening.
definitions.example: The mother was in the second stage of labor and the fetus had just crowned, prompting a round of encouragement from the midwives.

definitions.definition: To cause to round upward; to make anything higher at the middle than at the edges, such as the face of a machine pulley.
To hit on the head.
To shoot an opponent in the back of the head with a shotgun in a first-person shooter video game.
In checkers, to stack two checkers to indicate that the piece has become a king.
definitions.example: “Crown me!” I said, as I moved my checker to the back row.

definitions.definition: To widen the opening of the barrel.
To effect a lodgment upon, as upon the crest of the glacis, or the summit of the breach.
To lay the ends of the strands of (a knot) over and under each other.
Of, related to, or pertaining to a crown.
definitions.example: crown prince

definitions.definition: Of, related to, pertaining to the top of a tree or trees.
definitions.example: a crown fire

definitions.definition: To make the shrill sound characteristic of a rooster; to make a sound in this manner, either in gaiety, joy, pleasure, or defiance.
To shout in exultation or defiance; to brag.
definitions.example: He’s been crowing all day about winning the game of cards.

definitions.definition: To test the reed of a double reed instrument by placing the reed alone in the mouth and blowing it.
A criminal who plunders at sea; commonly attacking merchant vessels, though often pillaging port towns.
definitions.example: You should be cautious due to the Somali pirates.

definitions.definition: An armed ship or vessel that sails for the purpose of plundering other vessels.
One who breaks intellectual property laws by reproducing protected works without permission
A bird which practises kleptoparasitism.
A kind of marble in children's games.
To appropriate by piracy, plunder at sea.
definitions.example: They pirated the tanker and sailed to a port where they could sell the ship and cargo.

definitions.definition: (intellectual property) To create and/or sell an unauthorized copy of
(intellectual property) To knowingly obtain an unauthorized copy of
definitions.example: Not willing to pay full price for the computer game, Heidi pirated a copy.

definitions.definition: To engage in piracy.
definitions.example: He pirated in the Atlantic for years before becoming a privateer for the Queen.

definitions.definition: Illegally imitated or reproduced, said of a trademarked product or copyrighted work, or of the counterfeit itself.
The burden or recurring theme in a song.
A surplus.
To surmount (a physical or abstract obstacle); to prevail over, to get the better of.
definitions.example: to overcome enemies in battle

definitions.definition: To win or prevail in some sort of battle, contest, etc.
definitions.example: We shall overcome.

definitions.definition: To come or pass over; to spread over.
definitions.example: I was overcome with anger.

definitions.definition: To overflow; to surcharge.
